final_answer:
The humor in this image lies in the stark contrast between the actions shown in the two panels. The first panel features a pink money gun, which is used to shoot money flamboyantly, suggesting wealth and excess. The second panel shows a person crouching and carefully picking up scattered money from the floor, depicting an almost opposite scenario of careful frugality or desperation.

The caption "Yes, But" enhances this contrast, highlighting the difference between the glamorous expectation of having money and the reality of needing to gather it meticulously. It satirizes consumer culture or the illusion of wealth, showing that the appearance of wealth (shooting money) can be quite different from the underlying reality (collecting scattered money).
